remarks: Show that a binary operation preserves eventual boundedness. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 15-Sep-2014.)
statement:
o1of2.1 $e |- ( ( m e. RR /\ n e. RR ) -> M e. RR ) $.
o1of2.2 $e |- ( ( x e. CC /\ y e. CC ) -> ( x R y ) e. CC ) $.
o1of2.3 $e |- ( ( ( m e. RR /\ n e. RR ) /\ ( x e. CC /\ y e. CC ) ) -> ( ( ( abs ` x ) <_ m /\ ( abs ` y ) <_ n ) -> ( abs ` ( x R y ) ) <_ M ) ) $.
o1of2 $p |- ( ( F e. O(1) /\ G e. O(1) ) -> ( F oF R G ) e. O(1) ) $.
$d F m n x y $.
$d G m n x y $.
$d M x y $.
$d R m n x y $.
